alert.note: Alert for Jemez Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 4:29PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL RIO ARRIBA AND NORTHEASTERN SANDOVAL COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM MDT... At 428 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fenton Lake State Park, or 18 miles southeast of Cuba, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Jemez Springs, Fenton Lake State Park, and Jemez State Monument. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
